addstaff.brief: Adds staff with given discord ID to DB. Requires role `Neko Herder`.
addstaff.description: This command can be used to add new staff to the database. This is required if you want the bot to interact with a newly introduced staffmember.

usage.e: Discord ID of the staffmember you want to add.

addstaffexp.brief: A way to add staff to the DB without an actual discord account existing. Requires role `Neko Herder`.
addstaffexp.description: This came up during testing, that sometimes you need to add staff that just doesn't exist on the server. Requires role `Neko Herder`.

usage.e: This is basically the discord ID. - **REQUIRED**
Name of the dummy that's going to be displayed. - **REQUIRED**

addchapter.brief: Adds a chapter to the database.
addchapter.description:
Add a chapter to the database. Requires raws to do so, as well as a project it belongs to. 
 Aliases: `addc, addch, ac`

donetl.brief: Mark a chapters translation as done. Requires role `Translator`
donetl.description: Mark a chapters translation as done. Automatically adds the correct date and will mark command executor as new translator, if the position was set to None. Requires role `Neko Worker.`

usage.e: True/False. Define whether to ping the next member.

donerd.brief: Mark a chapters redraws as done. Requires role `Redrawer`
donerd.description: Mark a chapters redraws as done. Automatically adds the correct date and will mark command executor as new redrawer, if the position was set to None. Requires role `Redrawer`

usage.e: True/False. Define whether to ping the next member.

donets.brief: Mark a chapters typeset as done. Requires role `Typesetter`
donets.description: Mark a chapters typeset as done. Automatically adds the correct date and will mark command executor as new typesetter, if the position was set to None. Requires role `Typesetter`

usage.e: True/False. Define whether to ping the next member.

donepr.brief: Mark a chapters proofread as done. Requires role `Proofreader`
donepr.description: Mark a chapters proofread as done. Automatically adds the correct date and will mark command executor as new proofreader, if the position was set to None. Requires role `Proofreader`

usage.e: True/False. Define whether to ping the next member.

doneqcts.brief: Mark a chapters qctypeset as done. Requires role `Typesetter`
doneqcts.description: Mark a chapters qctypeset as done. Automatically adds the correct date. Requires role `Typesetter`

usage.e: True/False. Define whether to ping the next member.

addproject.brief: Adds a project to the database. Requires role `Neko Herder`.
addproject.description:
Add a project to the database. Requires role `Neko Herder`.
 Aliases: `addp, addproj, ap`

usage.e: Project's status (mostly either active or inactive) - **REQUIRED**
Alternative project titles, separated by comma - **REQUIRED**
Link to small icon next to the title in the board entry.
Link to thumbnail in the board entry.

infochapter.brief: Retrieve information about one or multiple chapters. Requires role `Neko Worker`.
infochapter.description:
Display information about projects in form of a table,
which is either sent as an image or as plain text. Requires role `Neko Worker`.
 Aliases: `infochapter, infoc, ic`

usage.e: Chapters with numbers from this point on
Chapters with numbers up to this point
Filter by link, also accepts `None` as value.
Filter by date. Identical commands exist for `ts, rd, pr, qcts and rl`
Can be either `image` or `text`. Defaults to `image`.
Possible values: `title, id, link_{step}, tl, rd, ts, pr, d_c (date it was created on), d_{step} (Date)`

editchapter.brief: Edits a chapter in the DB.
editchapter.description:
Edits a chapter in the DB. Prompts you with a preview, react with one of the two buttons to either confirm or dump the changes.
 Aliases: `editchapter, editc, ec`

usage.e: Chapter ID used to select chapter. - Alternative to using `-p=` and `-c=`
Change the project of the chapter
Replaces ALL of the notes by the value of this param.

infoproject.brief: Retrieve information about one or multiple projects. Requires role `Neko Worker`.
infoproject.description:
Display information about projects in form of a table,
which is either sent as an image or as plain text. Requires role `Neko Worker`.
 Aliases: `infoprojects, infop, ip`

usage.e: Filter by status, mostly either `inactive` or `active`
When this param is used, all projects will be displayed. (Keep in mind to not apply any filters)
Can be either `image` or `text`. Defaults to `image`.
Possible values: `title, id, tl, rd, ts, pr, link, status, altNames`

editproject.description:
Edit a project. Prompts you with a preview, react with one of the two buttons to either confirm or dump the changes. 
 Aliases: `editproj, editp, ep`

usage.e: Project ID, used to select project. - Alternative to using `-p=`
Edit status of project. Mostly either `active` or `inactive`
Edit link to the project's folder

clear.brief: Clears out all tables of a chapter. Requires role `Neko Herder`
clear.description: Clears out all tables of a chapter. Requires role `Neko Herder`

editstaff.brief: Edits a staffmember's entry in the database. Requires role `Neko Herder`
editstaff.description: Edits a staffmember's entry in the database. Requires role `Neko Herder`

usage.e: Internal ID used to select member. - **REQUIRED**
New name, used whenever bot refers to member.

allprojects.brief: Simple command to display all projects. Requires role `Neko Worker`.
allprojects.description: Simple command to display all projects. Requires role `Neko Worker`.

allstaff.brief: Simple command to display all staffmembers. Requires role `Neko Herder`.
allstaff.description: Simple command to display all staffmembers. Requires role `Neko Herder`.

release.brief: Simple command to mark a chapter as released.
release.description: Simple command to mark a chapter as released.

usage.e: The chapter's id - Alternative to using `-c=` and `-p=`
Set the chapter's title manually, instead of using the current time.

mycurrent.brief: Simple command to display all your currently unfinished chapters. Requires role `Neko Worker`.
mycurrent.description: Simple command to display all your currently unfinished chapters. Requires role `Neko Worker`.

avatar.brief: Retrieve avatar of a server member.
avatar.description: Retrieve avatar of a server member.

usage.e: Discord ID, Name, Nickname or mention of the user. Doesn't have a dash or anything in front.

cat.brief: Retrieve a picture of a cat. (Note: Really slow)
cat.description: Retrieve a picture of a cat. (Note: This is really slow)

usage.e: image type. gif, jpeg or png

debugboard.brief: Used to reset the information board. Requires role `Neko Herder`.
debugboard.description: Used to reset the information board. Requires role `Neko Herder`.

usage.e: Number of messages in the board that are going to get deleted. - **REQUIRED**

embed.brief: Can be used to test hex colors.
embed.description: Can be used to test hex colors.

note.brief:
Display all notes of a chapter. Requires role `Neko Worker`.
Aliases: `n, notes`
note.description:
Display all notes of a chapter. Requires role `Neko Worker`.
Aliases: `n, notes`

addnote.brief:
Add a note to a chapter. Requires role `Neko Worker`.
Aliases: `an`
addnote.description:
Display all notes of a chapter. Requires role `Neko Worker`.
Aliases: `an`

remind.brief:
Setup a reminder. Requires role `Neko Worker`.
Aliases: `r`
remind.description:
Will remind a staffmember on the specified time. If no tz is passed, GMT will be assumed.
Aliases: `r`

usage.e: The datetime to remind on. Can be in any format (that is not ambiguous), since it uses a different parser. - **REQUIRED**
Timezone you assumed while typing out the datetime. - Optional, if not given, GMT is assumed.
Serveruser you wish to remind. If not given, message author will be reminded. - Optional
